intro: Ptychoraphis cagayanensis, commonly known as the Cagayan spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
